1.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a Moabite or Moabitess, i.e. a descendant from Moab

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Bilam, a Mesopotamian prophet; also a place in Palestine
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
to divide (in variation senses literally or figuratively, separate, distinguish, differ, select, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the web (or transverse threads of cloth); also a mixture, (or mongrel race)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

25.brief: properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to polish; by implication, to make bald (the head), to gall (the shoulder); also, to sharpen
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

these or those

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
